meanings.definition: A thing serving as a visible or tangible representation of a fact, quality, feeling, etc.
meanings.sent1: She kept the lucky token in her pocket for good luck.
meanings.sent2: The medal he received was a token of appreciation for his hard work.
meanings.sent3: The token she found on the sidewalk made her smile.
meanings.sent4: His kind gesture was a token of his true character.
meanings.sent5: The token of friendship they exchanged was a small keychain.

meanings.definition: A voucher that can be exchanged for goods or services.
meanings.sent1: He handed the token to the cashier to get his free drink.
meanings.sent2: The concert ticket was the token for entry into the venue.
meanings.sent3: She found a token for a discount at the local bakery.
meanings.sent4: The token for the amusement park ride was in his pocket.
meanings.sent5: The token for the bus ride was a small paper slip.

meanings.definition: A piece of stamped metal or plastic used as a substitute for money.
meanings.sent1: He inserted the token into the arcade machine to play a game.
meanings.sent2: The subway token was needed to pass through the turnstile.
meanings.sent3: She collected tokens from different countries as souvenirs.
meanings.sent4: The casino token gleamed under the bright lights.
meanings.sent5: The token for the parking garage was a small silver disc.

meanings.definition: A symbol or sign used to represent something.
meanings.sent1: The dove is often seen as a token of peace.
meanings.sent2: The heart shape is a token of love and affection.
meanings.sent3: The handshake was a token of agreement between them.
meanings.sent4: The white flag is a token of surrender in battle.
meanings.sent5: The red rose is a token of passion and romance.
